quest.name: Parley on the Front Lines
journal: Hien stands ready to depart for Ala Mhigo.

Hien gives orders in preparation for his departure to Ala Mhigo, and Alisaie shares the instructions she received from Lyse. You are to head to Porta Praetoria, where a Resistance fighter will escort you to Alliance Headquarters on Ala Mhigo's northeastern border.
You locate the Resistance fighter ordered to await your arrival in the Lochs. Without further ado, you follow your guide to the Alliance's newly constructed field camp.

After listening to your various reports concerning Alphinaud, Gaius, and the lethal Black Rose, Lyse shares her own piece of news: it seems that Emperor Varis himself will be taking a chair at the negotiation table on the condition that you and another member of the Scions are present. Lyse bids you let her know when you are prepared to attend the parley.

※In the event that you leave Alliance Headquarters, speak with the Resistance fighter in Porta Praetoria to re-enter the field camp.

You attend the first round of parley only to witness Emperor Varis dismantle every argument the Alliance leaders bring against him. Rather than let the opportunity for peace slip away, Alisaie begs the Empire's ruler to consider alternatives to war. The Emperor grudgingly agrees to a short recess, granting you time to confer with your comrades.

※In the event that you leave the Garlean Legion Tents, speak with the Resistance fighter in Porta Praetoria to re-enter the site of the parley.

Alisaie suspects Emperor Varis has attended the parley for reasons other than brokering a peace. She suggests you speak with the Alliance leaders, and formulate a strategy for learning the Emperor's true purpose.
You speak with each of the Alliance leaders in turn, and discuss a number of potential tactics. It is time to report to Alisaie with the insights you have gained.

The parley reconvenes, and the Alliance leaders at last elicit a blunt answer from Emperor Varis. But the revelation is hardly a welcome one. He explains how the Empire is a creation of the Ascians, and that to reclaim the world for the races of man, all nations must join together as one. The assembled dignitaries balk at his ultimatum─that in order to win their freedom, they must allow the Rejoining to proceed. Unable to countenance a sacrifice of that scale, you, too, add your voice to the chorus of defiance, and the talks rapidly disintegrate. With the Emperor's hostile farewell still ringing in the air, your party withdraws to Alliance Headquarters.
Though peace was never a likely outcome, it seems the parley was successful in its primary purpose: the delay has allowed the vanguard from Doma time to arrive before hostilities begin in earnest...
objectives: Speak with the Resistance fighter in Porta Praetoria.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: Go on ahead, Forename. I will join you in Ala Mhigo with our advance party as soon as I can.

dialogue.name: HAKUROU
dialogue.text: While you and my lord Hien are away crossing swords with the Empire in distant Ala Mhigo, I shall be here with the remainder of our forces, watching our borders. Pray send the Garleans my regards.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Come, let's return to Lyse and share the good news about our Far Eastern reinforcements.

dialogue.name: KIENKANGATEKEEPER03028
dialogue.text: Lord Hien is expecting you. May I show you in?

dialogue.name: EVENTAREA
dialogue.text: Enter the Kienkan?

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: We must leave now to convene with Eorzea's leaders, and it may be some time before I return to Doma.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Hakuro─I leave you in command.

dialogue.name: HAKUROU
dialogue.text: My lord!

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: I shall assemble an advance party with all haste, and join you in Ala Mhigo forthwith.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I've just received word from Lyse. The Alliance has established a base camp near Ala Mhigo's northeastern border.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Once we've arrived in the Lochs, we're to report to a Resistance officer stationed in Porta Praetoria who will point us in the right direction. Let's not keep them waiting.

dialogue.name: HAKUROU
dialogue.text: Seiryu's Wall is a formidable barrier, but we cannot afford to lower our guard even for a moment. Only constant vigilance will keep Doma safe from her enemies.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Here we are again, ready to fight the same foe... Yet I would not be anywhere else. This conflict concerns us all. Come what may, we cannot allow the Empire to regain its grip on Ala Mhigo.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Here. I think we've found the guide Lyse mentioned.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEGATEKEEPER
dialogue.text: Ah, you must be the Scion party I was told to look out for! If you'll follow me, I'll take you directly to Alliance Headquarters.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Accompany the Resistance fighter to Alliance Headquarters?

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Is Emperor Varis in thrall to the Ascians? That is the question.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: If Sharlayan could not negotiate peace with the Empire, I rather doubt war can be avoided here. But every moment we steal for our preparations will count in the final reckoning.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Should the Empire decide to ignore the rules of parley, we could be fighting far sooner than we'd like. Keep your weapons close.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Well, I don't suppose it's polite to keep an emperor waiting too long. Shall we?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Parley with the Emperor?

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: For years have we warred with the Empire, and with no end in sight. A parley such as this represents a unique opportunity, and I would not squander it with bitter words.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Varis holds fast to his ideals, just as I knew he would. He will not be swayed from this path.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Why do I get the feeling the Emperor is hiding something...?

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: 'Tis true that Limsa Lominsa's beginnings were not wholly honorable. But our old wrongs do not make the Empire's deeds right.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: I do much wonder at Emperor Varis's decision to attend these negotiations... It is plain he has no intention of hearkening to our entreaties. But what then is his goal?

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: For a moment, I feared our talks would descend into violence there and then. Alisaie speaks of her dislike for politics, but her honest plea may very well have prevented an early battle.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: Whatever rebuttal I had in mind was lost when Varis mentioned my father. The man is certainly skilled at keeping his opponents off balance.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEGATEKEEPER
dialogue.text: Shall I escort you to the parley, madamsir?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Proceed to the Garlean Legion Tents?

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEGATEKEEPER03182
dialogue.text: If you wish, I can escort you directly to the parley, madamsir.

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: Proceed to the Garlean Legion Tents?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Phew. This is really not my forte.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: After His Radiance's little performance, it was all I could do not to swear at him. I honestly don't know how I ended up playing the mediator.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I just asked myself what Alphinaud would have done, tried my best to do the same, and...by some miracle, it worked.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But there really is no common ground to be found with that man─nor do I think he looked for any. So the question becomes, what did he come here to do─because you may be certain it wasn't to make peace.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: <sigh> ...Whatever it is, I can't make it out─not yet, at least. We do have a little time before the parley is due to reconvene, though, so why not try consulting our illustrious leaders? Mayhap they have some insight to share.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: The meeting isn't due to reconvene for a while yet. You might want to ask the others what they think the Emperor is after. It's not impossible one of them could have spotted something we've missed.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Twelve have mercy... But for Lady Alisaie's timely interjection, we might well have come to blows at the negotiating table.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Not that Emperor Varis left us a great many options. Is unconditional surrender all he will accept, do you think?

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Ere he arrived, I'd have said yes. But having heard him speak...I cannot help but think he came with some other end in mind.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Exactly! He's building up to something, I know it!

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Hmm... How then should we approach the rest of the parley? Have you anything to say, Warrior of Light?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Invite Varis to explain himself.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Say nothing of Zenos or the Ascians.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: You believe he is more apt to reveal the truth if we put him at his ease? ...Mayhap you are right.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: I will say one thing for this Varis─he is well versed in Eorzean history.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: His interest in our affairs is that of a beast in its prey. The conqueror would know his enemies.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: All should know their enemies. Yet there is much and more we do not know of the Empire.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I'm sure Varis would be happy to tell you more...

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Then it's up to us to change that. Here and now.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Hah! You would have me ask the Emperor himself? Well, mayhap there is some wisdom in that.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: If we can skirt the storm of his displeasure, we may yet come to our answers...even if it does mean sailing close to the wind.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: This parley was never like to bring peace, but I had hoped to learn something of Emperor Varis's relationship with the Ascians...

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: As had we all. Yet if he is in league with them, he is not like to volunteer the fact─and if he is not...how much weaker would his position seem for their presence. If we are to broach that particular subject, we will need to be subtle... <sigh> Would that I knew more of the man... If you would indulge me, Lord Hien: you received an imperial education, did you not? Is it true that the Emperor's will is considered absolute?

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: There is no higher authority in all of Garlemald, nor else in the heavens, come to that. Veneration of the gods is forbidden─the only worship permitted being that of His Radiance's own person.

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: That sounds suspiciously like a religion in itself.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: I share your disdain for their hypocrisy. Even as they denigrate the idea of faith, they revere their leader with a fervor others reserve for the divine.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: 'Tis a flaw common to much of the doctrine they fed us─logical on the surface, perhaps, but contradictory upon closer examination. I wonder if a discussion of the various discrepancies might prompt Varis to reveal something...?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: You've spoken with everyone then? Good. Now, all that remains is to await the pleasure of the Emperor, and hope we fare better at the second attempt...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I came back to find Doma's advance party ready and waiting for battle. So, as worrying as our little chat with the Emperor was, it did buy enough time for at least some of our allies to arrive.
